author: cbs8
title: Energy stocks lead the market down as oil price slumps - CBS News 8 - San Diego, CA News Station - KFMB Channel 8
text:
By MATTHEW CRAFT
AP Business Writer NEW YORK (AP) - Energy companies are leading U.S. stocks mostly lower in midday trading as the price of oil takes another fall.
U.S. crude sank 2 percent Friday after Goldman Sachs said a global glut of oil could push prices as low as $20 a barrel.
Drilling companies had some of the biggest losses. Rig operator Transocean slid 6 percent.
The Standard & Poor's 500 index lost two points, or 0.1 percent, to 1,950.
The Nasdaq composite gave up eight points, or 0.2 percent, to 4,788.
The Dow Jones industrial average bucked the trend, adding 22 points, or 0.2 percent, to 16,356.
Bond prices rose. The yield on the 10-year Treasury note fell to 2.18 percent.
